quote: Judge a man by his questions rather than by his answers.
author: Voltaire

quote: Common sense is not so common.
author: Voltaire

quote: I disapprove of what you say, but I will defend to the death your right to say it.
author: Voltaire

quote: Appreciation is a wonderful thing: It makes what is excellent in others belong to us as well.
author: Voltaire

quote: Every man is guilty of all the good he did not do.
author: Voltaire

quote: God is a comedian playing to an audience too afraid to laugh.
author: Voltaire

quote: The secret of being a bore is to tell everything.
author: Voltaire

quote: It is difficult to free fools from the chains they revere.
author: Voltaire

quote: Think for yourselves and let others enjoy the privilege to do so too.
author: Voltaire

quote: No problem can withstand the assault of sustained thinking.
author: Voltaire

quote: Doubt is not a pleasant condition, but certainty is absurd.
author: Voltaire

quote: Love truth, but pardon error.
author: Voltaire

quote: The best is the enemy of the good.
author: Voltaire

quote: Work banishes those three great evils: boredom, vice, and poverty.
author: Voltaire

quote: It is forbidden to kill; therefore all murderers are punished unless they kill in large numbers and to the sound of trumpets.
author: Voltaire

quote: Prejudices are what fools use for reason.
author: Voltaire

quote: The more I read, the more I acquire, the more certain I am that I know nothing.
author: Voltaire

quote: Men are equal; it is not birth but virtue that makes the difference.
author: Voltaire

quote: To succeed in the world it is not enough to be stupid, you must also be well-mannered.
author: Voltaire

quote: Appreciate what you have, endure what you must, and change what you can.
author: Voltaire
